Key Match Events: Roston Chase hit 50 in the run-chase
Andre Russell took the 50th wicket of his T20 international career
Post-Match Reflections: Chase said, 'I'm very pleased. Starting the tournament with a win is always good. I needed to take it home for the team, and I did it.'
Papua New Guinea captain Assad Vala said, 'We were very happy with the way we fought - we got wickets at key moments.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies were perhaps not as assured as they would have liked in the response
Alei Nao removed Johnson Charles lbw for a duck in the second over
Brandon King made some in-roads, scoring 34 off 29 balls before his skied shot was caught by Lega Siaka off the bowling of captain Assad Vala
West Indies found themselves on 97/5 with just four overs remaining after the loss of Rovman Powell and Sherfane Rutherford
